DOC.brief_summary: A randomised trial determine whether e-cigarettes ( without nicotine ) combine nicotine patch behavioural support assist smoker remain abstinent least six month .
DOC.brief_title: The Use Nicotine Patches Together With E-cigarettes ( With Without Nicotine ) Smoking Cessation
DOC.detailed_description: A pragmatic , double-blind , three-arm randomise controlled trial undertaken New Zealand determine whether e-cigarettes combine nicotine patch assist smoker remain abstinent least six month . 1809 smoker motivate quit recruit community use medium advertise randomly allocate one three group , namely 1 ) 21mg nicotine patch daily , 2 ) 21mg nicotine patch daily plus 'new generation ' e-cigarette nicotine 3 ) 21mg nicotine patch daily plus 'new generation ' e-cigarettes nicotine . Participants instructed start use study product two week prior quit date , continue 12 week quit date . Participants also receive cessation behavioural support programme consist least six follow-up telephone call ( 10-15 minute ) first six week . Outcome data collect participant 's set quit date , one , three , six ( ) 12 month post-quit date .
DOC.criteria: Smoke want quit next three month Reside New Zealand At least 18 year age Able provide verbal consent Have access telephone ( mobile and/or landline ) Are prepared use nicotine patch nicotine patch ecigarette together . Only one person per household eligible . Pregnant woman Women breastfeed Current user NRT product People currently enrol another smoking cessation programme cessation study People use ecigarette one week last year smoke cessation Current user nonnicotine base cessation therapy ( e.g . buproprion , clonidine , nortriptyline varenicline ) . People heart attack , stroke severe angina within previous two week . People selfreport history severe allergy and/or poorly control asthma .
